column4: hi all... how do I do if I can't format (or modify partition table) of a flash USB drive?
I inserted it, found it on 'lsusb' (and also /dev/sdb come created), BUT I can't access to it (tried with many partition tools)
what does sudo fdisk -l say? (should list all devices and partitions)
nothing abount sdb.... only hard drive detected
does it show up on mount -l
can you access the USB stick with dolphin?
I don't know what it is... i'll try now
dolphin is a filebrowser... or konqueror or somethign else...
now mount -l or sudo fdisk -l should show it...
I have hotpluggable scsi drives, and they become visible after a sudo scsiadd -s ... then I can do what I want with them
ok, thanks selfsame..... I think anyone lat it fall! bye
